Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using an induced pluripotent stem cell (iPSC) line derived from control individuals and patients carrying either the c.629G>A or c.1087A>G PINK1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced mitochondrial ROS levels were observed in cells expressing the c.629G>A variant.
Increased mitochondrial ROS levels were observed in cells expressing the c.1087A>G variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate for technical consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 cDNA was used as a positive control to validate the assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Studentâ€™s t-test with a two-tailed unpaired design was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial ROS levels within the range of 50-80% compared to control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial ROS levels deviating by more than 20% from the normal range.
